required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Safety and Tolerability of Artificial Tears in Dry Eye Subjects
clinical_study.official_title: Safety and Tolerability of Artificial Tears in Dry Eye Subjects

brief_summary.textblock: The safety and tolerability of two new artificial tears will be compared to a currently-available artificial tear in subjects with dry eye. Each subject will receive all three products in a randomly assigned order. The subject will use one product at a time for a duration of one week before switching to the next assigned product.

primary_outcome.measure: Tolerability Questionnaire Mean Scores at 1 Week
primary_outcome.description: Tolerability Questionnaire mean scores at 1 week. The Tolerability Questionnaire includes 8 tolerability questions on selected performance measures. All questions are scored based on continuous visual analog scale from 0-100. The first 4 questions presented measure increasing tolerability where 0=worst and 100=best. The second set of 4 questions presented measure decreasing tolerability where 0=best and 100=worst.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Patients With at Least One Severity Grade Increase in Biomicroscopy Findings at 1 Week
secondary_outcome.description: Number of patients with at least one severity grade increase in biomicroscopy findings at 1 week. Eyes are examined with a special microscope (biomicroscopy), and findings scored using a 5-point scale (0=none, +0.5=trace, +1=mild, +2=moderate, +3=severe). An increase in severity grade indicates worsening.

secondary_outcome.measure: Best-Corrected Visual Acuity (BCVA) Status at 1 Week
secondary_outcome.description: BCVA status at 1 week reported as the number of patients whose scores were either "Better", "No Change", or "Worse" than their scores at baseline. The status was tabulated as number of lines read correctly at 1 week minus the number of lines read correctly at baseline. "Better" equals increase of 2 lines or more in at least 1 eye; "No Change" equals change between -2 to +2 lines in either eye; "Worse" equals decrease of 2 lines or more in at least 1 eye. BCVA is measured using a special eye chart and is reported as the number of lines (5 letters per line) read correctly.

secondary_outcome.measure: The Number of Ophthalmic Adverse Events at 1 Week
secondary_outcome.description: The number of ophthalmic adverse events (AE) at 1 week. An ophthalmic AE is any unfavorable and unintended sign, symptom, or disease related to the eye which occurs during the use of the study investigational product

arm_group.description: Formulation 1: Carboxymethylcellulose Sodium, Glycerin and Polysorbate 80, based artificial tear
Formulation 2: Carboxymethylcellulose Sodium, Glycerin and Polysorbate 80, based artificial tear

arm_group.arm_group_label: Glycerin and Polysorbate 80 based artificial tear
arm_group.description: Glycerin and Polysorbate 80 based artificial tear

intervention.intervention_name: Formulation 1: Carboxymethylcellulose Sodium, Glycerin and Polysorbate 80, based artificial tear
intervention.description: 1 to 2 drops into each eye three times per day

intervention.intervention_name: Formulation 2: Carboxymethylcellulose Sodium, Glycerin and Polysorbate 80, based artificial tear
intervention.description: 1 to 2 drops into each eye three times per day

intervention.intervention_name: Glycerin and Polysorbate 80 based artificial tear
intervention.description: 1 to 2 drops into each eye three times per day
intervention.arm_group_label: Glycerin and Polysorbate 80 based artificial tear

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Mild, moderate or severe symptoms of dry eye
Exclusion Criteria:
- Uncontrolled systemic disease
- Contact lens wear
- Participation in another clinical study

participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: This is a 3-treatment, 3-period, 6-sequence crossover study. Each subject received all 3 products in a randomly assigned order. The subject used 1 product at a time for a duration of 1 week before switching to the next assigned product (e.g., with treatments A, B, and C, the sequences were ABC, ACB, BAC, BCA, CAB, and CBA).

group.title: Sequence ABC
group.description: Started with Treatment A: Artificial Tear Formulation 1 followed by Treatment B: Artificial Tear Formulation 2 followed by Treatment C: Glycerin and Polysorbate 80 based artificial tear

group.title: Sequence ACB
group.description: Started with Treatment A: Artificial Tear Formulation 1 followed by Treatment C: Glycerin and Polysorbate 80 based artificial tear followed by Treatment B: Artificial Tear Formulation 2

group.title: Sequence BAC
group.description: Started with Treatment B: Artificial Tear Formulation 2 followed by Treatment A: Artificial Tear Formulation 1 followed by Treatment C: Glycerin and Polysorbate 80 based artificial tear

group.title: Sequence BCA
group.description: Started with Treatment B: Artificial Tear Formulation 2 followed by Treatment C: Glycerin and Polysorbate 80 based artificial tear followed by Treatment A: Artificial Tear Formulation 1

group.title: Sequence CAB
group.description: Started with Treatment C: Glycerin and Polysorbate 80 based artificial tear followed by Treatment A: Artificial Tear Formulation 1 followed by Treatment B: Artificial Tear Formulation 2

group.title: Sequence CBA
group.description: Started with Treatment C: Glycerin and Polysorbate 80 based artificial tear followed by Treatment B: Artificial Tear Formulation 2 followed by Treatment A: Artificial Tear Formulation 1

group.description: All Study Participants

outcome.description: Tolerability Questionnaire mean scores at 1 week. The Tolerability Questionnaire includes 8 tolerability questions on selected performance measures. The second set of 4 questions presented measure decreasing tolerability where 0=best and 100=worst.
outcome.population: Safety population, which consisted of all patients who started the study (randomized) and received treatment.

class.title: How comfortable is drop in the eye?
How soothing is drop in the eye?
How moistening/lubricating is drop in the eye?
How clear is vision with drop in the eye?
How much stickiness with drop in the eye?
How much blur with drop in the eye?
How much burning/stinging with drop in the eye?
How much discomfort with drop in the eye?

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: A disclosure restriction on the PI is that the sponsor can review results communications prior to public release and can embargo communications regarding trial results for a period that is less than or equal to 90 days from the time submitted to the sponsor for review. The sponsor cannot require changes to the communication and cannot extend the embargo
